name: Onion Rings
history: Onion Rings are a popular snack and side dish in Western cuisine, particularly in the United States. They consist of onion slices deep-fried in a crispy batter. The exact origin is unknown, but they have been a staple in American diners and fast-food restaurants for decades.
description: Onion Rings are a classic snack made from slices of onion coated in a savory batter and deep-fried until golden and crispy. They are known for their crunchy exterior and tender onion inside, often served with dipping sauces like ketchup or ranch.

equipment.name: deep fryer or heavy-bottomed pan
equipment.description: For deep frying the onion rings.

equipment.name: mixing bowls
equipment.description: For preparing the batter and dredging the onions.

instructions.title: Prepare the Onions
instructions.description: Peel the onions and slice them into 1/4-inch thick rings. Separate the rings.

instructions.title: Make the Batter
instructions.description: In a bowl, mix together flour, cornstarch, baking powder, paprika, salt, and black pepper. In another bowl, whisk together the milk and egg. Combine the wet and dry ingredients to form a batter.

instructions.title: Dredge the Onion Rings
instructions.description: Dip each onion ring into the batter, ensuring it's fully coated, then carefully place it in the hot oil.

instructions.title: Fry the Onion Rings
instructions.description: Heat oil in a deep fryer or heavy-bottomed pan to 375Â°F (190Â°C). Fry the onion rings in batches until they are golden brown and crispy, about 2-3 minutes per batch. Drain on paper towels.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the onion rings hot with your choice of dipping sauces.

tips: Ensure the oil is at the correct temperature before frying to avoid soggy onion rings.
Do not overcrowd the pan while frying, as it lowers the oil temperature.
variations: Add different spices to the batter, like garlic powder or cayenne pepper, for extra flavor.
Use beer instead of milk in the batter for beer-battered onion rings.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed immediately. Can be stored for a few hours.
storage.instructions: Keep in a warm oven if not serving immediately.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat in a preheated oven at 350Â°F (175Â°C) until crispy.
presentationTips: Serve in a basket lined with parchment paper for a classic look.
Garnish with fresh parsley and serve with a side of creamy ranch or spicy ketchup.
